front.title: Best Current Practice for OAuth 2.0 Client Authentication in Workload Environments

abstract.t: The use of the OAuth 2.0 framework for container orchestration systems poses a challenge as managing secrets, such as client_id and client_secret, can be complex and error-prone. "Service account token volume projection", a term introduced by Kubernetes, provides a way of injecting JSON Web Tokens (JWTs) to workloads. This document describes the current best practices to avoid client_secret provisioning and leverage platform attestation to receive access tokens from an OAuth 2.0 authorization server via RFC 7523.
